description: Chapter 687 of WoodmenLife has suspended all events until after May 31. WoodmenLife Chapter 687, Kittanning, has canceled its June 12 picnic/annual Oct. 2 fall banquet, due the current health concerns. The Armstrong County Sportsmen/Conservation League annual banquet has been rescheduled from April 4 to 6 p.m. Sept. 26 at the Kittanning Township fire hall,...
text:
The following cancellations/changes has been reported to the Leader Times:

Chapter 687 of WoodmenLife has suspended all events until after May 31.
Members will be notified when events resume. For information, call
724-545-7210.

The Kittanning High School Class of 1951 will cancel its June monthly
luncheon. A decision will be made later about the July luncheon. For
information, call 724-548-4624.

WoodmenLife Chapter 687, Kittanning, has canceled its June 12 picnic/annual
Oct. 2 fall banquet, due the current health concerns. For more information,
watch the Leader Times, Facebook, emails, connect with one of chapter
attendees or the chapter secretary at 724-545-7210.

The Armstrong County Sportsmen/Conservation League annual banquet has been
rescheduled from April 4 to 6 p.m. Sept. 26 at the Kittanning Township fire
hall, 13126 Route 422. Program will feature Mark Ternent PGC Black Bear
Biologist. Meal will roast turkey served thresherman style. Cost of tickets is
$15 each/must be purchased in advance of the Sept. 15 deadline. For tickets or
for more information, contact any league officer or call Ron at 724-548-7941
or Bruce at 724-840- 5786. Tickets are also available at the Armstrong County
Treasurer's Office.

Take out only spaghetti dinner offered in church

St. John's Lutheran Church, 1038 Fourth Ave., Ford City, will hold a take out
only spaghetti dinner from 4-6 p.m. May 30. Cost is $8 each. Phone-in orders
will be accepted from noon to 4 p.m. May 30, call 724-763-9622 or patrons may
walk-in to order.

Drive-thru ham dinner on tap in fire hall

The West Kittanning Volunteer Fire Dept., 401 Arthur St., will hold a drive
through ham dinner from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 31. Cost is $10. Menu will
consist of ham, parsley potatoes, green beans, coleslaw, roll and cake. Event
is first come, first served. Proceeds will benefit the fire department.

Application postmark deadline extended for Bernie Smith Scholarship

The Armstrong Indiana Clarion Drug & Alcohol Commission (AICDAC) has announced
the Bernie Smith Scholarship. The scholarship was established in honor of
Smith, a Indiana County Commissioner, who passed away in 2006. Honorees shall
be chosen from the graduating class in Armstrong, Clarion and Indiana
counties. Students applying should be exemplifying the mission of AICDAC
throughout their high school career. Students must be furthering their
education in some fashion: college, trade school, etc. More than one
application per school district is welcomed. Application postmark deadline is
extended to May 31. For an application or for more information visit
[aidac.org](http://aidac.org), call 724-354-2746 ext. 302 or contact local
school guidance office.

Discount available for natural sciences program for adults set at ODC

In a first for Armstrong County, Armstrong Center for Community Learning will
host the Pennsylvania Master Naturalist program for adults in the fall at its
Outdoor Discovery Center, 142 Kerr Road, in Bethel Township. A Pennsylvania
Master Naturalist is an individual with a passion for the natural world who
participates in an intensive training course and uses his or her knowledge by
giving back to the community through volunteer service. The training in
Armstrong County is scheduled to run August through October on Wednesday
evenings, with four Saturday field trips during that period. An early bird
discount is in effect and applications will close on June 1. For more
information, visit [armstrongcenter.org/](http://armstrongcenter.org/)
pamasternaturalist or contact Maeve Rafferty,
[mrafferty@pamasternaturalist.org](mailto:mrafferty@pamasternaturalist.org).

Allegheny Valley Chapter of the Women's Business Network meetings to be held
online

The Allegheny Valley Chapter of the Women's Business Network will meet at 8
a.m. on both June 2 and June 16. All meetings will be conducted online until
further notice. To register or for more information, call Susan Kinger at
412-782-4848 or [skinger607@dollarbank.com](mailto:skinger607@dollarbank.com).

RV Helping Hand Center to reopen with restrictions

Rural Valley Helping Hand Center, 204 Cowanshannock Ave., Rural Valley, will
reopen on June 2. Regular business hours are 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Tuesday,
Wednesday and Thursday and 9 a.m. to noon Saturday. Multiple restrictions
apply due to COVID-19. Masks are required for admittance. Three shoppers, at a
time, will be permitted in store. There will be a 15-minute shopping time to
be fair to all customers. No children will be admitted at this time. The
church sponsored organization is run by volunteers who provide aid to local
organizations and those in need with the proceeds. For information, call
814-257-8608 and leave message.

Parade planned to honor

AHS Class of 2020

The Armstrong High School Class of 2020 will parade in Ford City/Kittanning on
June 2. Parade will begin at 7 p.m. at the high school/ continue to Ford
City/proceed to the end of Ford City on Fifth Avenue, then come back on
Fourth. Paraders will pass through Manorville, on the way to Kittanning. In
Kittanning, the route will travel on South Water Street, turn right on Market
Street at the bridge, travel up Market to the courthouse, where parade ends.
Senior class advisors ask all community members to show support of the
graduating class by turning on porch lights at 8:20 p.m., which is 20:20 in
military time. Commencement ceremonies usually finish at about this time. For
information, call 724-548-7600.

Basement rummage sale planned in church

A basement rummage sale will be held from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. June 5 and 6 at the
Kittanning Free Methodist Church, 2339 Freeport Road, in East Franklin
Township. For information, call 724-543-1237.

Registrations accepted for virtual divorce workshop for women

A divorce workshop for women will be held from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. June 6.
This four-hour workshop will be held via video conference educate on the
legal, financial and emotional issues of divorce. This workshop will arm
attendees with the knowledge and understanding needed to navigate the divorce
process and with the least amount of conflict and cost as possible. Materials
cost is $35 per person. Pre-registration deadline is June 3, call Donna at
724-493-9695.

2-day ATV awareness ride

The Scrubgrass Village OHV Park will host a two-day ATV awareness ride event
on June 6-7 at 1130 Ridge Road, Templeton. Gates open at 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. each
day. Participants are asked to have correct amount of money for fees. There
will be no exchange of money. Fee is $25 per driver and $15 per
passengers/spectators daily. Overnight camping is free/pets welcome.
Fishing/kayaking permitted as per Pennsylvania's fishing laws. No night
riding, weapons or alcohol permitted. Helmets are required/social distance is
in place. Protective clothing is recommended. For information, call Steve
Stiller at 412-607-0960 or visit riderplanet
[usa.com@svohvpark.pa.state](mailto:usa.com@svohvpark.pa.state).

Phone-in/take out only roast beef dinner on tap at fire hall

A phone-in/take out only roast beef dinner will be held beginning at 11 a.m.
June 7 at the Manor Township fire hall, 163 Byron St., Mc- Grann. Cost of meal
is adults, $10; children, 6-12, $5; and free to 5 and younger. For take outs
or more information, call 724-763-1981.

Tickets available for online only gun bash at fire hall

A gun bash will be held online only on Facebook June 7 at the Kittanning
Township fire hall, 13126 Route 422. For tickets, call 724- 548-7290. Proceeds
will benefit the fire department.

Registrations accepted for summer day kamp in church

Harvest Community Church, 143 Reed Road in East Franklin Township, will host a
summer day kamp for ages 6-12. The camp will run Monday-Friday from 9 a.m. to
4 p.m. June 15-Aug. 7. Space is limited. To register, or for more information,
call 724-548-5643 ext. 39 or visit [harvestpa.org](http://harvestpa.org).

Ford City Hose Co. 1 announces new non emergency phone number

The Ford City Hose Co. 1, 1000 Fourth Ave., has announced its new station
number is 724-763-1828. Everyone is asked to use this number, when they need
to contact the fire department for a non emergency.

Church school has openings

The Evangelical Lutheran Church School, 136 W. Main St., Worthington, has
openings for its developmentally appropriate ½ day kindergarten program,
featuring three Pennsylvania state certified teachers, small class size and
one-on-one phonics program. Children learn through centers: STEM, dramatic
play, reading, writing, computer, music, art, blocks and games. Bussing is
provided by Armstrong School District. Speech provided by ARIN. Openings also
available for its 4-year-old afternoon preschool class. Scholarships available
for preschool and kindergarten. For more information, email
[asgoldinger@yahoo.com](mailto:asgoldinger@yahoo.com) or leave message at the
school 724-297-5600.

YOUR LOCAL EVENTS

Does your nonprofit or community organization have special events or dinners
coming up that you would like to see in the Leader Times?

Free News to Use listings must be no more than 120 words and include a name,
date and time for the event, an address, information about ticket or admission
prices, and a phone number for the public to call for more information.

All listings should be sent at least two weeks prior to the event, and be
written as they would appear in the paper.

To be included in the daily News to Use section, email information (preferred)
to [newsroom@leadertimes.com](mailto:newsroom@leadertimes.com), or mail or
deliver a copy to the Leader Times, 1270 N. Water St., Kittanning, Pa., 16201.

title: News to Use
html:
The following cancellations/changes has been reported to the Leader Times:

Chapter 687 of WoodmenLife has suspended all events until after May 31. Members will be notified when events resume. For information, call 724-545-7210.

The Kittanning High School Class of 1951 will cancel its June monthly luncheon. A decision will be made later about the July luncheon. For information, call 724-548-4624.

WoodmenLife Chapter 687, Kittanning, has canceled its June 12 picnic/annual Oct. 2 fall banquet, due the current health concerns. For more information, watch the Leader Times, Facebook, emails, connect with one of chapter attendees or the chapter secretary at 724-545-7210.

The Armstrong County Sportsmen/Conservation League annual banquet has been rescheduled from April 4 to 6 p.m. Sept. 26 at the Kittanning Township fire hall, 13126 Route 422. Program will feature Mark Ternent PGC Black Bear Biologist. Meal will roast turkey served thresherman style. Cost of tickets is $15 each/must be purchased in advance of the Sept. 15 deadline. For tickets or for more information, contact any league officer or call Ron at 724-548-7941 or Bruce at 724-840- 5786. Tickets are also available at the Armstrong County Treasurer's Office.

Take out only spaghetti dinner offered in church

St. John's Lutheran Church, 1038 Fourth Ave., Ford City, will hold a take out only spaghetti dinner from 4-6 p.m. May 30. Cost is $8 each. Phone-in orders will be accepted from noon to 4 p.m. May 30, call 724-763-9622 or patrons may walk-in to order.

Drive-thru ham dinner on tap in fire hall

The West Kittanning Volunteer Fire Dept., 401 Arthur St., will hold a drive through ham dinner from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. May 31. Cost is $10. Menu will consist of ham, parsley potatoes, green beans, coleslaw, roll and cake. Event is first come, first served. Proceeds will benefit the fire department.

Application postmark deadline extended for Bernie Smith Scholarship

The Armstrong Indiana Clarion Drug & Alcohol Commission (AICDAC) has announced the Bernie Smith Scholarship. The scholarship was established in honor of Smith, a Indiana County Commissioner, who passed away in 2006. Honorees shall be chosen from the graduating class in Armstrong, Clarion and Indiana counties. Students applying should be exemplifying the mission of AICDAC throughout their high school career. Students must be furthering their education in some fashion: college, trade school, etc. More than one application per school district is welcomed. Application postmark deadline is extended to May 31. For an application or for more information visit aidac.org, call 724-354-2746 ext. 302 or contact local school guidance office.

Discount available for natural sciences program for adults set at ODC

In a first for Armstrong County, Armstrong Center for Community Learning will host the Pennsylvania Master Naturalist program for adults in the fall at its Outdoor Discovery Center, 142 Kerr Road, in Bethel Township. A Pennsylvania Master Naturalist is an individual with a passion for the natural world who participates in an intensive training course and uses his or her knowledge by giving back to the community through volunteer service. The training in Armstrong County is scheduled to run August through October on Wednesday evenings, with four Saturday field trips during that period. An early bird discount is in effect and applications will close on June 1. For more information, visit armstrongcenter.org/ pamasternaturalist or contact Maeve Rafferty, mrafferty@pamasternaturalist.org.

Allegheny Valley Chapter of the Women's Business Network meetings to be held online

The Allegheny Valley Chapter of the Women's Business Network will meet at 8 a.m. on both June 2 and June 16. All meetings will be conducted online until further notice. To register or for more information, call Susan Kinger at 412-782-4848 or skinger607@dollarbank.com.

RV Helping Hand Center to reopen with restrictions

Rural Valley Helping Hand Center, 204 Cowanshannock Ave., Rural Valley, will reopen on June 2. Regular business hours are 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday and 9 a.m. to noon Saturday. Multiple restrictions apply due to COVID-19. Masks are required for admittance. Three shoppers, at a time, will be permitted in store. There will be a 15-minute shopping time to be fair to all customers. No children will be admitted at this time. The church sponsored organization is run by volunteers who provide aid to local organizations and those in need with the proceeds. For information, call 814-257-8608 and leave message.

Parade planned to honor

AHS Class of 2020

The Armstrong High School Class of 2020 will parade in Ford City/Kittanning on June 2. Parade will begin at 7 p.m. at the high school/ continue to Ford City/proceed to the end of Ford City on Fifth Avenue, then come back on Fourth. Paraders will pass through Manorville, on the way to Kittanning. In Kittanning, the route will travel on South Water Street, turn right on Market Street at the bridge, travel up Market to the courthouse, where parade ends. Senior class advisors ask all community members to show support of the graduating class by turning on porch lights at 8:20 p.m., which is 20:20 in military time. Commencement ceremonies usually finish at about this time. For information, call 724-548-7600.

Basement rummage sale planned in church

A basement rummage sale will be held from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. June 5 and 6 at the Kittanning Free Methodist Church, 2339 Freeport Road, in East Franklin Township. For information, call 724-543-1237.

A divorce workshop for women will be held from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. June 6. This four-hour workshop will be held via video conference educate on the legal, financial and emotional issues of divorce. This workshop will arm attendees with the knowledge and understanding needed to navigate the divorce process and with the least amount of conflict and cost as possible. Materials cost is $35 per person. Pre-registration deadline is June 3, call Donna at 724-493-9695.

2-day ATV awareness ride

The Scrubgrass Village OHV Park will host a two-day ATV awareness ride event on June 6-7 at 1130 Ridge Road, Templeton. Gates open at 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. each day. Participants are asked to have correct amount of money for fees. There will be no exchange of money. Fee is $25 per driver and $15 per passengers/spectators daily. Overnight camping is free/pets welcome. Fishing/kayaking permitted as per Pennsylvania's fishing laws. No night riding, weapons or alcohol permitted. Helmets are required/social distance is in place. Protective clothing is recommended. For information, call Steve Stiller at 412-607-0960 or visit riderplanet usa.com@svohvpark.pa.state.

Harvest Community Church, 143 Reed Road in East Franklin Township, will host a summer day kamp for ages 6-12. The camp will run Monday-Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. June 15-Aug. 7. Space is limited. To register, or for more information, call 724-548-5643 ext. 39 or visit harvestpa.org.

Ford City Hose Co. 1 announces new non emergency phone number

The Ford City Hose Co. 1, 1000 Fourth Ave., has announced its new station number is 724-763-1828. Everyone is asked to use this number, when they need to contact the fire department for a non emergency.

Church school has openings

The Evangelical Lutheran Church School, 136 W. Main St., Worthington, has openings for its developmentally appropriate ½ day kindergarten program, featuring three Pennsylvania state certified teachers, small class size and one-on-one phonics program. Children learn through centers: STEM, dramatic play, reading, writing, computer, music, art, blocks and games. Bussing is provided by Armstrong School District. Speech provided by ARIN. Openings also available for its 4-year-old afternoon preschool class. Scholarships available for preschool and kindergarten. For more information, email asgoldinger@yahoo.com or leave message at the school 724-297-5600.

YOUR LOCAL EVENTS

Does your nonprofit or community organization have special events or dinners coming up that you would like to see in the Leader Times?

Free News to Use listings must be no more than 120 words and include a name, date and time for the event, an address, information about ticket or admission prices, and a phone number for the public to call for more information.

All listings should be sent at least two weeks prior to the event, and be written as they would appear in the paper.

To be included in the daily News to Use section, email information (preferred) to newsroom@leadertimes.com, or mail or deliver a copy to the Leader Times, 1270 N. Water St., Kittanning, Pa., 16201.
